basics.name: Khandaker Abrar Nadib
basics.label: PhD Student, Computer Science
basics.summary: Second-year PhD student at the University of Utah (Visualization Design Lab & KORE Lab) focusing on visualization, HCI, and data-driven misinformation. Former full-stack engineer with three years of industry experience.

work.name: Scientific Computing and Imaging Institute (SCI), University of Utah
Optimizely
work.position: Software Engineer II — Digital Asset Management Team
work.summary: Worked across Python/Flask and JS/TS/React in the DAM product.
highlights: Technologies: Python, Flask, JavaScript, TypeScript, React.js, MySQL, MongoDB, Alembic, Celery, Elasticsearch.

work.name: Optimizely
work.position: Software Engineer I — Digital Asset Management Team
work.summary: Built user-facing features and backend improvements for the DAM platform.
highlights: Implemented Brand Template features including download, export, access, and task integration.
Implemented searching, filtering, and navigation in DAM collection folders; added user activity tracking for analytics.
Built asset features (meta information, relations, bulk operations) and GPT-3.5-turbo integration for smart content.
Handled roles/privileges; performance and code quality improvements across backend and UI.
Technologies: Python, Flask, JavaScript, TypeScript, React.js, MySQL, MongoDB, Alembic, Celery, Elasticsearch.

work.name: Optimizely
work.position: Software Engineering Intern — Asset Renditions Team
work.summary: Developed rendition services and tooling for asset pipelines.
highlights: Implemented and maintained the Asset Rendition feature with three rendition generators.
Built stateless generators and asynchronous messaging for scale; integrated local dev tooling.
Implemented logging schemes across services; Technologies: Python, FastAPI, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Docker, Kubernetes, Message Queue.

education.summary: Second-year PhD student, Kahlert School of Computing.

publications.name: Interaction Based Credibility Analysis of News on Facebook Using Machine Learning Methodologies
publications.summary: Interaction-based ML for Bengali fake-news credibility; resilient to adversarial content.

projects.name: News Credibility Analysis on Facebook using User Interaction Data
projects.description: Interaction-based ML for Bengali-language news credibility during COVID-19 and beyond.
highlights: Outperformed content-based/NLP baselines using interaction metrics; resilient to adversarial content.

projects.name: Heuristic Analysis of bKash
projects.description: Usability analysis of the bKash mobile financial app.
highlights: Interviewed users; identified and ranked usability issues.
Recommendations to enhance accessibility and multimodality.
